snippet: Jérôme Valcke, the longtime right-hand man of the suspended FIFA president Sepp Blatter, was banned from all soccer-related activity for 12 years for misconduct during his term as FIFA secretary general.
abstract: Former FIFA secretary general Jerome Valcke is banned from all soccer-related activity for 12 years following misconduct allegations.
lead_paragraph: Jérôme Valcke, the longtime right-hand man of the suspended FIFA president Sepp Blatter, was banned from all soccer-related activity for 12 years for misconduct during his term as FIFA secretary general.
